010package MorphologicalFilters;
011
012import ij.ImagePlus;
013import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
014import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
015import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
016import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.NeighborhoodType2D;
018import imagingbook.common.morphology.BinaryMorphologyOperator;
019import imagingbook.common.morphology.BinaryOutline;
020
021/**
022 * This ImageJ plugin demonstrates morphological outline calculation
023 * on binary images. Pixels with value 0 are considered
024 * background, values &gt; 0 are foreground. The plugin 
025 * modifies the supplied image.
026 * 
027 * @author WB
028 * @version 2022/01/24
029 *
030 */
031public class Outline_Demo implements PlugInFilter {
032        
033        private static NeighborhoodType2D nh = NeighborhoodType2D.N4;
034        
035        @Override
036        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus imp) {
037                return DOES_8G;
038        }
039
040        @Override
041        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
042                
043                if (!showDialog()) {
044                        return;
045                }
046                
047                BinaryMorphologyOperator outline = new BinaryOutline(nh);
048                outline.applyTo((ByteProcessor) ip);
049        }
050        
051        private boolean showDialog() {
052                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(this.getClass().getSimpleName());
053                gd.addEnumChoice("Neighborhood type", nh);
054
055                gd.showDialog();
056                if (gd.wasCanceled())
057                        return false;
058                
059                nh = gd.getNextEnumChoice(NeighborhoodType2D.class);
060                return true;
061        }
062        
063}
064
